favourite.article: Hi David DeTar, I think that line means... How I have proved Him over and over. Please someone should correct me if I am wrong, I need to know too.
I have never understood the line How I've proved Him o'er and o'er. (Whenever I sing this song I sing How I need Him more and more.) So if anyone knows please tell me
Awesome!!!!!!!! Beautiful Truth l love You Jesus.
Trusting Jesus means to me totality and submission to His will. The song heals anytime I listen to it, the melody and the words.
This hymn is our family anthem. Trusting God makes life easier. Good gospel hymn.
How could life have been without trusting in Jesus,Thank You Jesus if I have die early I could have been in hell by this time. My saviour give me more Grace to Trust You, Amen.
Everything to me You are Lord.
Trusting in Jesus have seen me out difficult situations over and over. I have no option but to trust Him more and more. Oh!! what could I have done without Jesus.
I trust You precious Jesus, Oh for grace to trust Him more.
I trust in Jesus. He will never forget me.
O how sweet to trust in Jesus! Precious Jesus, Savior, Friend! Aleluya! We love You, oh Lord!
I will forever trust You LORD. You never fail, thank You for redeeming me on this day 1 July 2016. All praise and glory to THEE.
Oh Lord..i will trust You....You are faithful...
Each time I project this Hymn in the Church, It used to encourage me to trust Him more and More.
This is a favorite hymn of mine. It brings me comfort and perspective. It reminds me that the Lord will lighten all my burdens as I trust Him and become as submissive as a little child.
I love this hymn. One of my favorites. I live my life based on the trust I have in Jesus and He has been my keeper. I love You Lord...
We sang this at the Women's Retreat I went to on April 28th to the 30th. This was one of my grandmother's favorites. While I was singing it, I could imagine my grandmother singing along with me

My Spirit Keep singing this Hymns...... It really Tastes so Sweet indeed to trust the Lord! and to take Him by His Word Just to rest upon his Promise that NEVER FAILS. Thanks for the tone and uploading, it lift up mine soul all through. it really a new day everyday to trust the JESUS.
You have made my day and have quench my thirst for the lyric of this song. You will not understand what joy you have brought to my spirit. But I say only will bless you. AMEN
I'm so glad I learned to trust Thee and I hope for grace to trust Him more. Thank You Jesus for Your grace which is sufficient for me.
Oh for grace to trust Him more!

I am so convinced that God is sovereign because it is so sweet just to trust in Jesus just to take Him at His word just to rest upon His promise just to know thus saith the Lord. Thank You Jesus for loving us all enough to give Your very life so that we may have eternal life with You.
Tis so sweet to trust Him because of Grace and mercy I can see tomorrow with good health, loving and for giving heath I just love Him more each day. AMEN.
The need to trust is of utmost importance and it's my heart desire. Lord multiple Your grace in my life to completely depend and rely on You for Your faithfulness.

I have listen to this Song now for over and hour''' I play the Guitar' tryed to learn to play the Piano' but did not'' Jesus 'Jesus how I Trust Him''' That says it ALL What Great and Sounding Piano' Great' God's Got Saved People all over the WORLD!!!!!! Thank you So VERY Much.

I lift my voice with all others commenting here - regardless of nation or denomination - Jesus, Jesus how I trust Him! How I’ve proved Him o’er and o’er! TRUST JESUS! (the Amy Grant version of this btw is sweet and certain).
Jesus, my Savior, I love Thee forever more. Thank You for saving a wretch like me. I cannot wait to see Your Holy Face.
It's such an inspiration to listen to coz I know that Thou art with me and,...wilt be with me to the end. I love You my Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

The message in the song is inspiring and prophetic as well. He is Precious, Savior and Friend. There is an underlying conviction that words alone cannot express. Praise God for the revelation that Jesus will be with all believers beyond this life.
Going through a difficult time, building my trust again in Jesus my Lord and lover of my soul. Indeed tis so sweet to trust in Jesus, there is so much peace in it. Thank You Lord.

I have been heavily burdened lately because of hurtful words and false accusations. I love my Lord and King and have lived most of my life knowing that He has been more than faithful to me. How can those who claim to love and follow our Lord, wound others so deeply and without remorse? I didn't know it was possible to be hurt so deeply until lately. I am thankful for tears and for others who can weep with me. I am also thankful for Louisa Stead who in wrote the words to - Tis So Sweet to Trust in Jesus. Perhaps she too knew the pangs of suffering. The lyrics were certainly written from a heart who was in love with the Lord Jesus. As I began singing each verse, I felt the strength of God rising within me and Oh how I needed that. I know my storm will eventually pass and friend take courage because yours will too. "How I've proved Him over and over and I am persuaded that He will keep me to the very end.
I love God so much! It's wonderful to read so many worshipful comments about or Savior and this beautiful song of adoration!

Thank You Jesus for it is good to trust in You. I know You will not fail me in Jesus Name. I am so glad I learnt to trust in You. You will see me through this year and beyond in Jesus Name. Thank you for uploading this song and God bless you all. Amen and Amen!!!

Just got saved July 1, and I can't tell you how great it felt to be relieved of a huge burden, and feeling the strength that Jesus gave me, and I know most of the time it's hard because of how prone we are to sin, but when you trust in Jesus it is something completely, supernaturally different and you will never regret it!
Listened to it alone in my hotel room in Myanmar this morning. O, how wonderful Jesus is! Every word of this precious song is true. Amen!

This hymn is full of assurances of God's goodness. I remembered this hymn greatly during the years of our civil conflict as a nation. It was regularly sang by the congregation, and was indeed one of the hymns that kept the brethren strong and active despite the destruction and death around us. I was younger then, but I have grown loving this hymn.
Looking unto Jesus, the author, finisher, lifter, Promoter of my life. I trust solely on You! Do not leave me nor forsake me.
Tis so sweet to trust in Jesus. How I have proved HIM o'er n o'er...Thank You for Your Love Jesus.

This hymn always keep me going whenever I'm faced with a difficult situation n also reminds me of victories Jesus has given me in past challenges.I encourage whoever reads this to keep singing it till d battle is over.
JESUS IS FAITHFUL, I have proven HIM over & over!!!

The hymn is very rich and loaded with encouragement. Challenges are real but His trust will always see us through especially when we meditate on His promises that are relevant to the challenge. Never you rush to your kneel until you know what He promised in His Word!
I just cant express what I feel each time I sing this hymn. Very inspiring!
This song is so powerful, it moves me to tears.Truly Jesus is EVER FAITHFUL!!!!!!!
I like the song so much dear. Kindly send me the copies/ word into my mail. Thanks pls
He never leave you nor forsake you. I can trust Him. "Proven over and over"
Indeed....! So wonderful to be reminded of how sweet it is to keep on trusting in my Friend, Saviour and Maker Jesus Christ.
This is such a moving hymn and I sang it in church this past Sunday. The only funny thing is that I am always getting it mixed up with a similar hymn.
Amen. I love this song. So comforting when going through trials to know that I can trust Jesus. Because He is in control, this shall come to pass.
This GREAT Hymn of the Faith is what has carried me through life's up and downs beginning with the many colicky nights with my baby girl back in the early 90's.
A very wonderful song indeed knowing that I can put my trust in the Lord Jesus and He will never fail me!

I had a dream and the next morning, the Lord reveal everything that happen in that dream as if I was living out the dream and He gave me a great peace during that moment, all I could sing is 'tis so sweet to trust in Jesus and oh for grace to trust Him more. Let us trust in Him.
Listening to this hymn in the morning as I started my day brought peace to my morning!!! Knowing that I can totally trust in Jesus.
I am inspired by this song and the lyrics keeps me trusting. I going to render this piece in church on Sunday to mark wedding anniversary.

I am so glad that His grace is sufficient enough for me to hold unto and trust Him, Jesus. Praise God for this amazing hymn and glad to learned to trust Him. It keeps me going in spite of the negatvity.
It's my favourite song especially when you are in fasting.

This hymn carries me when I'm in a battle, because I love the verse that says: Just to know Thus saith the Lord. His Holy word says it all. Trust, and He WILL bring it to pass. I never thought at 53 years old that I could fall in love again, but I have, with Jesus Christ, because I know how much He loves me. I'm SO thankful that I have a personal relationship with the Lord. Oh! How He loves us!!
It's such a beautiful song. Even my 2yr old sings it from time to time.
Wow, this hymn touch parts of my heart nothing else can reach. Lord, please help my heart to completely surrender daily.
This is a hymn I've come to love so much and the story behind it is inspiring.
Amazing! Just to be able to sing the verses of this song anywhere to music..... The words minister to me......Jesus, Jesus how I trust Him. He never fails me.
Does anyone know the story behind this hymn?

Thank you for this old hymn. It is an inspiration to me. Living in Maine can be cold and gloomy with the weather at times, but, knowing Jesus I have sunshine in my heart. Trusting Jesus for His grace and love that gets me through every day.

It's so, so sweet to indeed trust in Jesus and to know thus says The Lord in time of tribulations, trails, and all what have you. It is refreshing to know that He will be with me to the end. Girl! Am I glad that I have learned to trust Him cos the experience is so so cool and gratifying. Thank You Jesus for Your living word.
I am happy to know my Jesus is so precious, I love know Him more and more each day

I see people everyday transiting this world especially the so called rich & wealthy. But daily, also, I am faced with reality of Destiny fulfillment which can only be realized through my TRUST in Jesus to walk with Him. The hymn comes in handy each moment. Everyday, every hour, He is just faithful. It's the will of God for us to be rich & wealthy. Yes! but only in RIGHTEOUSNESS - Matt 6.33

I’m so glad I learned to trust Thee, My Precious Jesus, My Savior, and My Friend; And I know that Thou art with me, Wilt be with me to the end. Now happy that am not alone. Even if my mother neglects I know that I have a friend.
JESUS, JESUS how I trust HIM....O for grace I trust Him more....my precious Jesus....how much I trust and love You more and more!!!

In fact am so happy today to find the words of this particular song. I have been searching for it since 1998 when I heard it. it is very inspiritional and lovely. May God bless and help everybody that hears and sing this beautiful song. Amen.
Wonderful hymn...may we never lose the blessing of hearing these wonderful songs! "Oh for grace to trust Him more"
I am amazed at how these old hymns still minister to us.This song helps me to overcome sickness and depression. I love it so much!
Amen, how so sweet to trust in Jesus, hallelujah! We enjoy Christ everyday and gain Him more.
O Lord Jesus, I trust in You. How sweet Your love is, O Lord Jesus. I am glad that I am saved. Thank You Lord for saving me. I will praise You O Lord for Your kindness. O Lord,Jesus! Amen.

This use to be one of my favorite hyms in high school back in the day. I forgot the lyrics, and was humming the song during my private devotion. I decided to goggle it to retrieve the lyrics, surprisingly someone had developed a musical background of the song. I could not stop singing. God bless you richly for touching my life positvely.

This song helps me to consecrate my life and trust in God. It tells me o'er and o'er that my trust in Jesus Christ has no backup - it is a trust without spare. It may seem hard at times to trust in Jesus but it is sweet in the long run through faith and by His grace.

I sang this song in my dream and since that day, I can't stop singing the song and this song has made me to understand that it's all about trusting Jesus and also that the only thing that differentiate me as a Christian from other religion is the "GRACE" of God and I always pray for this grace to trust Him more and more.
This song is awesome...my wife and myself love it. It teaches us to rely on God. He is our Life.

Louisa Stead and her husband were relaxing with their 4-year-old daughter on a Long Island beach when they heard a desperate child's cry. A boy was drowning, and Louisa's husband tried to rescue him. In the process, however, the boy pulled Mr. Stead under the water, and both drowned as Louisa and her daughter watched. Louisa Stead was left with no means of support except the Lord. She and her daughter experienced dire poverty. One morning, when she had neither funds nor food for the day, she opened the front door and found that someone had left food and money on her doorstep. That day she wrote this hymn. - Great Songs of Faith by Brown and Norton
It's so sweet, yes it's so. I love word because it's speaking the mind of God to mankind. I'll continue to trust Him to the end.
It's one of my best hymns. I am sure going to fix it into my wedding programme.

As a couple, myself and my wife was waiting on God for the fruit of the womb, three years after our wedding, on getting to work one morning, the song came to mind and I searched for it, print and took it home to be our song every morning during our morning devotion. Not up to three month that we started singing the song; my wife conceived and gave birth to a bouncing baby boy. The boy is now 2 years plus, the mother teach him the same song, now he sings the song with the family. We are all happy. Glory to God and the Lord bless the soul of the song writer.

I couldn't stop singing this beautiful number since yesterday. I will hang on and keep trusting Jesus to the very end no matter what happens. This season has been the most difficult season of my life. It's as though the heavens are sealed over me. I used to hear the voice of my Savior but now it's dead silence. Just confusion and hopelessness. I have been crying to the Lord and confessing my sins to Him. My life is practically hanging in a balance. Lord have mercy on me. I'm dying because this silence. I know HE will answer me. Jesus, Jesus, Precious Jesus! Brothers and sisters, I would appreciate your prayers - thank you.

I prayed for inspiration what music we could bring to our congregation after the 9/11 World Trade tragedy, and this was the song God led me to. This song reminds us that our ultimate rest is found in Jesus and through the promises found in the Holy Scriptures. May all that find this beautiful hymn meditate upon and be blessed, healed, and comforted through this message. God bless you in Jesus' name!
This song is indeed one of the greatest song with real meaning that every one should sing and meditate on.

I am so blessed by this song. I woke up this Sunday morning and spontaneously begun singing the hymn. It reminds me my high school Scripture union fellowships and chapel time and reassures me how great it is to trust in Jesus. My faith is reignited by the song.
Very fantastic song! It makes me somehow to be changed.

This is a re-assuring song for me and my wife. We are trusting the Lord for the fruit of the womb. We have been married now for five years and each time we sing this song, it reinforces our trust in Jesus.
Your prayers are appreciated.
I was reading the book of my Papa Bishop David Oyedepo about faith and he refered to this song. I looked it up and Peace in my heart to Trust in God and everything will fall into place.
This song came to my heart this morning and I decided to search on Google. Thank GOD I found this lyric! My trust in JESUS is forever.
I have chosen to trust HIM alone and at HIS Word. Will share the great testimony.

Was praying this morning while going through the most painful and roughest time I've ever experienced; and this old hymn came to my heart and encouraged me to keep pressing on! That The Lord hasn't forgotten me (Isa. 41:10). Hope it blesses others.
Divine mercy...is my strength through this every day walk.

My wife was attacked by stroke first in March, 2012. A second attack occurred December 30th, 2012. The Lord preserved her life in both incidents. Right now we are trusting God for her full recovery. Just this night she began to sing this song. I had to google the song. Thank God I found it. As I began to play the song to her, her countenance changed. She was so excited and her face illuminated. I can read from her face that this song is an old long song lingering in her heart. I thank God for the words of the song because as I sing along with my wife, both of us felt refreshed. Our faith in God came alive. We are happy to know that there is hope for us because we trust Him (Jesus).

The tune of this song has been coming to my mind for a very long time but I was unable to lay hands on it, until now that I was inspired to search for it. Now I have it printed.
Jesus, Jesus, Precious Jesus!

Jesus indeed can be trusted. I stumbled on this song on the evening 31st December 2012 whilst preparing to go for cross over service. I was blessed and had to search for the lyrics the next day the 1st of January 2013. I have decided that will be my song every morning when I am having my quite time. ’Tis so sweet to trust in Jesus,Just to take Him at His Word;Just to rest upon His promise, And to know, “Thus saith the Lord!” Praise God!!!

My husband is on coumadin and woke me because he had some blood in urine mixed with water. I research for what to do and went into prayer, and this song came in my Spirit. The enemy Is trying to bring confusion because my word for Sunday is Trust coming from Proverbs 3:5-6. I got up and researched the song lyrics and it's so true our complete trust has to be in God. Thank You Lord for more Clarity on your Word for Sunday. God is awesome.
My spirit has been glued to this hymn since the day Pastor Bob Asare of Takoradi sang this song at the World Prayer Centre (then at Tema Comm. 12 Salvation).
Wow, It is indeed great to trust in Jesus. The song just dropped in my spirit and I had to search for the words. Let keep keep trusting Jesus.

This song has always been one of my favorite. Reading my devotion this morning - focusing on Trust in the Lord Prov 3:5 - the song came to mind I just had to search for the words. I found this and it strengthen me been off work today on sick leave. Thank You Lord!!
Over forty years this song has inspired on my daily life in all aspects of life. Now am 70+ and yet this song is ever new.
This song has blessed me this day I heard the tune and had to search for the words, thank You Jesus. It's really sweet to trust You in our day. God blesses the composer.
Facing difficult challenges that only TRUST and Complete Surrender will sustain me. I believe God is ever faithful and will resolve this huge problem in His own time, AMEN!
This song always bring my hope alive. It also strengthen my faith in God. Jesus, Jesus how I love You. I love You Jesus and I ask for grace to love Thee more.

Going through a challenging period in my life, and just been talking to God a lot today; more like crying out in tears. But this song came to mind after reading Psalm 56:3, "When I am afraid, I will trust in you." Thank You Lord that You never ever change: Your love, Your faithfulness, Your favour, Your goodness, Your mercies, You just never change-the solid rock on which I stand. I love You Lord, and I know that greater things are yet to come in Jesus' mighty name, Amen.

This hymn always brings tears to my eyes; it is my hymn for all seasons. It strengthens my spirit always and helps my faith. It always reminds me that I need not fear, no matter the situation, because I have more than I need- sweet Jesus. I bless the Lord for the soul of the one that left us with this wonderful constant reminder of the saving grace of God.

Trusting Jesus lightens the burden and challenges of life particularly in our Christian race. It's so sweet to trust in Jesus, for then will the promises of God be real to us, whether we are waiting for these promises or they are already manifested. Trust in Jesus always!!!
This song keeps hope alive. Lord give me grace to trust You till the end.
This hymn popped into my head when I thought I could not move on anymore. Dear Lord, thank You for considering me in all situations... even in my weakest days.
This brings me peace and joy to hear and to be able to sing all of the verses with the song.
These words of a classic hymn are greatly moving. O, how we as Christians should trust in Jesus. He is our Friend and a Savior. Thank You Lord.
This is song of all seasons and true in all cases when you trust in Jesus. Jesus is sweet to trust.

It's so interesting that so many comments have been made about the Spirit reminding the saints of this hymn. I was just praying, feeling really hopeless, asking the Lord to help me. When I called on His name "Lord Jesus!" the rest of the lyrics of the chorus came to me. "Jesus, Jesus, how I trust Him, How I've proved Him o'er and o'er, Jesus, Jesus, Precious Jesus! O for grace to trust Him more!" Thank You, Lord Jesus! May I learn to trust You in this way.

It is indeed sweet to trust in JESUS. This I have practised all times and got the positive results and that is why I love the song so well. May God bless the soul of the writer and those who post it on the internet in JESUS' name. Amen.

This is a wonderful song to listen to. The first time I heard about it was in church from a visiting choir and it kept on ringing my head until recently I found the lyrics on the internet. Oh, what a blessing of words I have received indeed "it is so sweet to trust in Jesus" always in order to remain pure. This song really blesses my heart!!!

I gave my life to Christ in Lagos, Nigeria in 1985, I kept pressing forward but challenges are too much for me to handle and it has been rough and hard to bear during these years of challenges. A week ago I walked into a church where the word of God came and the person asked me, if I have a Bible, even though I was with a Bible, she went ahead to give me the message that God sent to me in Isaiah 1:18 to come and reason with Him, that I should fast 2 days. At first I was in denial and a bit trouble that such message is for new born babe's in the Lord. But I could not resist the power in that message, then I knew God has come to rescue me and I went into a week fasting, then God started with me the book of Job 38:4. I can tell you that He lead me to several scripture passages to prove He's still in control, if I could trust. I immediately rededicated myself to God and promised to trust Him always. At the local church I attended yesterday, the entire messages and choir song was just the same message of trust and purity. I thank God that, I have program the song from your site 'TIS SO SWEET To TRUST IN JESUS in my computer to play the lyrics non stop. I praise God for you, who made this possible to the entire Christianity to listen. God bless you.
It is so sweet to trust Jesus.
Am a lover of hymns and I believe they carry power especially in the life of a believer. I love this hymn a lot and truly its so sweet to trust in Jesus, if only we can. Amen.

I was listening the man of God this morning teaching about singing hymns and psalms to worship God and to always be in the Spirit. He sang this chorus and just as I was about to sleep I found myself singing this song in my spirit so I decided look for the lyrics. To God alone be the Glory!

I was sleeping, praying, trusting God for a breakthrough yesterday!
But I woke up, with this song on my lips. I continue to sing, and I knew my case has been taken care of, by my precious Jesus!

This song sprang up in my spirit this morning and I just wanted to get all the lines right. It helps me to remind myself of how much I need to trust Jesus because without Him I can really do nothing. Daily, I need to trust HIM because I know His plans for me are grand. All I need is the grace to trust Him more. I love You Lord.

While in quiet time with my Heavenly Father this morning, Tis so Sweet rose up in my spirit. I started writing down some of the words that I remembered. Then the Holy Spirit lead me to look up the words. It's being used to strengthen my FAITH, CONFIDENCE and TRUST in my Father to keep me, guide me and establish His Will in my life. I LOVE HIM SOOOOOO MUCH!
There's no doubt! I've proven Him over and over!

Since I accept Him into my life, I have come to love, depend and trust Him in all circumstances. He never disappoints or lets me down even when He seems quiet, I have learned to wait on Him. I am encouraged by this song. 'Tis so sweet to trust in Jesus.
The name Jesus, is the sweetest name! the time I've known and received Him in my life....I trusted Him everything. Love this song!
I love this song. The words bring me back to the basics: take Him by His word. I cannot do anything meaningful without Jesus.
I have been crucified with Christ and it is no longer I that lives but Christ lives in Me (Gal. 2:20). He has been faithful, awesome and amazing in the years of service.
What song again should be on the mortal tongue if not to declare my absolute trust and dependence on Christ our Saviour. May the Lord be glorified forever. Amen.

This song is really touching. It draws me to my Saviour and teaches me to trust the Lord in all times.
I think this is the right anthem for all Christians during these hard times. Its all about trust and obedience to the voice of the Lord.

Amen.. the Lord is all that we need! Its just such a peaceful way to live, knowing that there is One that we can absolutely put our trust in. He is the most trustworthy person I know. Our Precious Lord Jesus. Taking us through the valley and to the mountain top... we know that in the end all things will work together for good because we are loving the Lord and are called according to His purpose. May this Hymn serve to water the brothers and sisters today:)
I like this song because it always strengthens and encourages me to trust in the Lord.

I love it that I have found a site I can go to for the songs I grew up with. I love the new praise and worshp songs of my church, The Rock, but sometimes I want to hear one of the old songs, the songs that lift your hearts, your spirit, a lot more quietly than the songs of today. They're good, and I love to sing them, clap my hands, and raise my hands as I sing along, but I also want to hear the songs that raise my heart as I raise my hands.
Sometimes I feel there is nothing to trust and hold on to but when I turn to the Lord it feels so sweet to trust in Him.
The best thing that has happened in my life is knowing Jesus and trusting Him is the sweetest thing, His Joy overwhelms me when I sing this song.
I like this song because it's really joyful and because there's so much you could do with it, like make it really bluesy!
Not to trust Jesus is so bitter. It is to be foolish. It is better by far to trust in Jesus. I've known this hymn for close to 20 years and it get sweeter by the day and more real.
Because when I really trust in Jesus for my every need, my spirit experiences a sense of peace that can only be described as sweet bliss.
It's so sweet to trust the Lord for His goodness to my life. When I give my life to Him everything became perfect! 'Tis so sweet to trust in Jesus!
